Navigation
Name Rascal/Patterns
Synopsis The various patterns that can be used for pattern matching.
Details Abstract Concrete PatternWithAction Regular
Description The following patterns are available:
  • Abstract: Abstract patterns.
  • Concrete: Concrete patterns.
  • PatternWithAction: A pattern with an associated action that is executed on a successful match.
  • Regular: Regular expression patterns.
Patterns may be used in:
  • cases of a Switch or Visit,
  • on the left of the Match operator (:=),
  • on the left of the Enumerator operator (<-), and
  • as formal parameters of Functions.
  • TryCatch statements to match thrown exceptions.
Each pattern binds variables in a conditional scope. A case statement is such a scope, so are the conditions of if, for, and while and the generators of comprehensions.
